availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Son of John Gracey and Mary Patten Gracey. Married to Zerilda O'Hara Gracey in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on February 4, 1830. Father of Mildred Gracey Kelly. Merchant in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Merchant in Lyon County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Lyon County in 1860. Held an additional three enslaved persons as the agent for Mildred Gracey Kelly in Lyon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film 000851644.
